parts:
Refer to the attached CSS file. I wish to write a Python script to refactor it. Strategy is to execute one algorithmic change at a time and then test the changes on the live website (index.html) before proceeding to the next step. For example, one step might be "if a rule is repeated or contradicted later in the CSS file, delete the old rule".

Suggest a sequence of such rules I can execute.
Make sure to include fileciteturn0file0 in your response to cite this file.
Make sure to include fileciteturn0file1 in your response to cite this file.

SG Maths Tuition

    Maths Tuition by Ph.D. holder

    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one and Small Group classes
    • Personalised lesson plans
    • University, JC, E/A maths
    • Latest MOE Syllabus + IP + IB
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    About The Tutor

    Greetings! This is Dr Ng, a dedicated private tutor in Singapore, specializing in Mathematics for Junior College and Upper Secondary, as well as Mathematics and Statistics at the University level.

    I strive to create a learning environment that is both enjoyable and enriching, ensuring that every student has a fulfilling educational experience.

    More than 80 percent of my students have seen at least a two grade improvement after just a few months of tuition. Many have achieved distinctions in their final examinations.

    Academic Qualifications

    • Ph.D (Mathematics) from National University of Singapore
    • B.Sc. (Honours - First Class) from National University of Singapore

    Experience

    • Full time tutor since 2010
    • Both tuition centre and home-based
    • Well-versed with latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus

    Various Levels Taught

    University Maths

    Mathematics at University and Polytechnic level is extremely broad in scope. I cover Probability & Statistics, Calculus of Several Variables, Linear Algebra, Analysis, Abstract Algebra, and Discrete Mathematics for Year 1 and 2.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Junior College Maths

    Junior College (JC) Mathematics is where I have the most extensive experience. I provide focused tracks for H2/H1 Mathematics, H3 Mathematics, and H2 Further Mathematics -- all latest MOE syllabus.

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Secondary Level

    I tutor both Elementary Maths and Additional Maths for G3 and G2 students (latest MOE syllabus) and also provide coverage for Integrated Programme (IP).

    WhatsApp Me Now

    Testimonials

      Contact

      Contact Information

      Complete the form or connect with me directly using the details below.

      DN
      Dr Ng
      Founder & Tutor

thoughts.content: It looks like I should propose a sequence of algorithmic refactors while including citations from the file. Since the CSS is large, I can focus on deduplicating variables, unifying duplicate ".hero" styles, and addressing repeated definitions for ".hero-media img". I'll need to make sure these updates are clear and tailored to the situation.

Okay, here's a step-by-step plan: I could resolve duplicate selectors by merging them into one, keeping the last definition. Then, I’ll merge theme-specific tokens and unify CSS variables. I'll also check for repeated definitions, like for .t-dot overrides. The plan should include parsing CSS to an AST, handling duplicates, and removing dead code based on usage.

I want to decide which classes to keep based on their relevance to the index.html, but I need to be careful not to remove anything necessary for other pages. Since the tests are only on index.html, I’ll incrementally remove unused features and comment them out for future reference. Then, I'll normalize units, unify shorthand expansions, ensure consistent property ordering, and merge media queries for better efficiency.

I’m thinking about how to optimize CSS. I should compute palette variables to replace hardcoded colors, potentially unify transition definitions, and simplify selectors—some seem unnecessarily high-specific. I'll also clean up unused vendor prefixes, combine repeated rules, and restructure the file by grouping logical components like hero, testimonials, etc. Lastly, I’ll address media query repetition by merging blocks.

I'll propose a structured sequence of optimization passes, focusing on hygiene, structural adjustments, behavior-preserving cleanup, cautious behavior changes, performance improvements, and removing unused selectors. Each pass should be explicitly defined, starting with simple fixes like whitespace cleanup and progressing through deduplication and normalization. I'll monitor the changes using a backup, ensuring minimal risk while improving CSS efficiency.

parts:
Great plan. Here’s a **safe, incremental sequence of refactoring passes** you can automate and run one-by-one, validating each pass against your current `index.html` harness. I’ve tailored the list to patterns actually present in your CSS (e.g., repeated `.hero` and testimonial-dot rules, multiple `@media (min-width: 1200px)` blocks, theme overrides, etc.). fileciteturn0file0 fileciteturn0file1

# Phase 0 — Harness & invariants (once)
1) **Snapshot + diff harness.** Before/after screenshots, DOM dump, and computed-style dump of the main templates (hero, split sections, programs grid, testimonials, contact card/form, footer). Treat visual diffs and key computed props as your “tests”. (You already have everything on `index.html` to exercise most components.) fileciteturn0file1  
2) **Selector allow-list for dynamic states.** Never remove selectors/classes that JS or ARIA sets at runtime even if “unused” in static HTML: `.active`, `.open`, `.force-close`, `[aria-selected="true"]`, `:focus-visible`, `:has()`, and the mobile/desktop breakpoints. (Your HTML ships with `class="no-js"` initially; JS may toggle it.) fileciteturn0file1

# Phase 1 — No-behavior “hygiene”
3) **Parse → normalize → re-serialize (idempotence).** Round-trip with a CSS parser (e.g., `tinycss2`) to fix trivial syntax quirks only (whitespace, duplicate semicolons, hex case). No reordering yet.  
4) **In-rule duplicate property collapse.** Within a single block, keep the **last** property occurrence and delete earlier identical/contradictory ones (e.g., `height:auto` followed by `height:100% !important` in the same selector → keep the last).  
5) **Exact-duplicate declaration removal.** If a selector block contains identical `prop:value` pairs repeated, keep one.  
6) **Canonical property formatting.** Normalize zeros (`0` not `0px`), color formats (prefer hex or `rgb()` consistently), and longhands/shorthands only when provably equivalent. (Cosmetic but reduces noise for later diffs.)

# Phase 2 — Cascade-safe consolidation
7) **Merge repeated selectors (same media scope).** If the same selector appears multiple times in the same media/query scope, **merge into a single block**, preserving last-one-wins for conflicting properties. Your stylesheet has repeated component rules (e.g., multiple `.hero …` and testimonial dot rules) that benefit here. fileciteturn0file0  
8) **Merge identical `@media` shells.** Combine multiple `@media (min-width: 1200px)` (and other identical queries) into a single query, then re-apply step 7 inside that query. Your file repeats the ≥1200px block. fileciteturn0file0  
9) **Lift identical rules across adjacent scopes.** If a block is identically defined both outside and inside a media query where the query doesn’t change the values, keep it in one place (usually the base). (Skip if any side uses `!important`.)

# Phase 3 — Conflict resolution (measurable behavior, still safe)
10) **Old-vs-new pattern replacement.** Where a later block **supersedes** an earlier layout pattern, remove the obsolete earlier declarations. Example: `.hero .hero-media` is first treated as an in-flow grid child, later it’s pinned absolutely as the backdrop (`position:absolute; inset:0; object-fit:cover`). Keep the later approach and drop earlier grid-placement properties on that selector to avoid accidental interactions. Validate the hero visually and via computed styles. fileciteturn0file0  
11) **Targeted contradiction cleanup in components.**  
   - **Hero:** unify multiple `.hero` / `.hero .hero-media img` definitions into a single, final definition per scope. Ensure there’s only **one** source of truth for hero image sizing/cropping. fileciteturn0file0  
   - **Testimonials dots:** you currently have staged “PATCH” sections redefining `.t-dot` states several times (including `::before`/`::after` and `!important`). Consolidate to one definitive implementation and delete the legacy/disabled versions. Re-test keyboard focus & selected state. fileciteturn0file0  
12) **Inline style tokenization (local variables).** Where a component hard-codes colors/sizes that should be tokens (e.g., hero background `#b68144`), introduce a **component-scoped custom property** (e.g., `--hero-bg`) and replace hard-codes. Do not change values yet—just route through variables so later theme passes are trivial. Validate contrast doesn’t change. fileciteturn0file0

# Phase 4 — Theme & specificity rationalization
13) **Theme map tightening.** You already map semantic tokens via `:root[data-theme="dark"]`. Replace scattered color constants in component rules (hero links, pills, contact card) with those semantic tokens or newly added local ones from step 12. The goal is: theme deltas happen in **one place** (theme maps), not deep in components. Re-test light/dark toggling from the header button. fileciteturn0file0  
14) **Specificity reduction (no visual change).** Where you over-specificy (e.g., `:root[data-theme="light"] #main-content .section.section--programs .hero-cta`), collapse to a lower-specificity rule by using variables or `:where()` wrappers so later overrides are simpler. Confirm the WhatsApp pill keeps its intended perimeter ring and hover. fileciteturn0file0  
15) **Remove unnecessary `!important`.** After steps 7–14, many `!important`s become redundant (e.g., in the testimonial dot patches). Remove them selectively; re-test the precise states they guarded (hover, selected, focus-visible). fileciteturn0file0

# Phase 5 — Structural tidying by component
16) **Group by component, then by breakpoint.** Reorder blocks so each component is contiguous: **Base → states → media queries**. (E.g., Hero, Sections/Split, Programs, Testimonials, Contact, Footer, Utilities.) This improves locality and eliminates “drift” that previously forced duplicates. Validate no change via computed-style hash per component root node. fileciteturn0file0  
17) **Consolidate transitions & shadows.** Extract repeated `transition`, `box-shadow`, and “pill” styles into utilities (e.g., `.u-pill`, `.u-elev-2`). Replace identical in-line declarations. Confirm CTAs still meet non-text contrast and focus ring requirements on both themes. fileciteturn0file0

# Phase 6 — Usage-aware pruning (guarded)
18) **Selector usage analysis vs. `index.html`.** Build a conservative selector-to-DOM matcher (CSS→simple XPath) and mark **definitely unused** selectors in this page. **Quarantine** them into `_maybe-unused.css` instead of deleting (many may be needed on other pages). Re-test page. (Keep dynamic allow-list from Phase 0.) fileciteturn0file1  
19) **Dead variable pruning.** Remove custom properties that are never referenced after consolidation. Again, quarantine to `_maybe-unused.css` first. fileciteturn0file0

# Phase 7 — Micro-optimizations (optional, measured)
20) **Clamp/unit normalization.** Standardize `clamp()` patterns and unit variants (e.g., unify `font-size` clamp shapes across sections; remove mixed `width`/`inline-size` unless you consciously rely on logical properties). Re-test responsive typography at key breakpoints. fileciteturn0file0  
21) **Media-query dedupe & sort.** Sort media queries by min-width and ensure there’s a single definition site per selector per breakpoint after earlier merges. This can shave parse time and avoids surprises in the cascade. fileciteturn0file0  
22) **Content-visibility sanity.** You use `content-visibility`/`contain-intrinsic-size` in sections and testimonials; verify they remain only where beneficial and not on containers that need accurate initial height for layout. Tweak or remove if LCP/CLS worsens. fileciteturn0file0

---

## Notes on two concrete hot spots to check after Passes 7–15
- **Hero block:** unify the image handling (grid vs absolute backdrop) and ensure only one final rule set wins for `.hero .hero-media` and `.hero .hero-media img`. Then verify headings, bullets, and pills at all breakpoints. fileciteturn0file0  
- **Testimonials dots & nav buttons:** keep exactly one modern implementation (`::before` dots, high-contrast ring, focus-visible outline); remove the legacy `::after` path entirely. Keyboard-tab through to confirm accessibility. fileciteturn0file0

---

If you want, I can also provide a small **Python refactor skeleton** that loads your CSS, runs passes as discrete steps (with a dry-run/diff per step), and auto-generates a `_maybe-unused.css` quarantine plus a simple **computed-style smoke test** by opening `index.html` in a headless browser and snapshotting target components.
